content.user_title: Review scientific manuscripts with structured peer review
content.value_statement: Scientific peer review requires systematic evaluation of methodology, statistics, and reporting standards. This skill provides structured workflows, checklists, and reference materials for rigorous manuscript and grant review across disciplines.
actual_capabilities: Conduct systematic peer review with stage-by-stage workflow
Evaluate statistical methods and experimental design rigor
Assess compliance with reporting standards (CONSORT, PRISMA, ARRIVE, STROBE)
Identify common methodological and statistical issues in manuscripts
Provide constructive feedback on scientific writing and figure quality
Review presentations with image-based evaluation workflow
limitations: Does not perform actual literature searches or access external databases
Does not substitute for domain expert judgment on specialized topics
Does not access or evaluate raw data files directly
Does not make accept/reject decisions - provides assessment framework only

use_cases.title: Manuscript evaluation workflow
use_cases.description: Systematic assessment of research manuscripts including methods, statistics, figures, and reporting standards compliance.

use_cases.title: Grant proposal assessment
use_cases.description: Evaluation of research proposals for rigor, feasibility, methodology, and alignment with funding objectives.

use_cases.title: Self-review before submission
use_cases.description: Pre-submission manuscript review to identify weaknesses and improve quality before journal submission.

prompt_templates.title: Basic manuscript review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this manuscript abstract and introduction. Identify the research question, main findings, and any immediate concerns about scope or novelty.

prompt_templates.title: Methods evaluation
prompt_templates.prompt: Evaluate the Methods section of this manuscript. Check reproducibility, statistical methods appropriateness, sample size justification, and ethical compliance.

prompt_templates.title: Full peer review
prompt_templates.prompt: Conduct a full peer review of this manuscript following the structured workflow. Provide summary, major comments, minor comments, and final recommendation.

prompt_templates.title: Reporting standards check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if this manuscript complies with [CONSORT/PRISMA/STROBE/ARRIVE] reporting standards. List any missing required elements.

output_examples.input: Review this manuscript introduction and methods section
output: Summary: Well-designed study addressing important research question. Methods generally sound with minor gaps in sample size justification.
Major concerns: 1) Power calculation not pre-specified, 2) Blinding procedures not described, 3) Control group not matched for age
Minor concerns: 1) Abbreviations not defined on first use, 2) Figure 2 legend incomplete, 3) Reference format inconsistent
Recommendation: Major revisions required before acceptance

best_practices: Use the stage-by-stage workflow for systematic evaluation rather than reviewing linearly
Distinguish major issues affecting validity from minor issues affecting clarity
Reference the reporting standards checklist appropriate to the study type
anti_patterns: Making accept/reject recommendations without thorough methodology review
Skipping the statistical rigor assessment for computational papers
Ignoring figure quality and data visualization issues

faq.question: What reporting standards does this skill support?
faq.answer: CONSORT (clinical trials), STROBE (observational studies), PRISMA (systematic reviews), ARRIVE (animal research), MIAME (microarray), and 15+ others.

faq.question: Can I use this for grant proposal review?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill includes specific guidance for evaluating research proposals, methodology, and feasibility.

faq.question: Does this skill evaluate raw data?
faq.answer: No, this skill reviews manuscript text and methodology descriptions. It does not access or analyze raw data files.

faq.question: How do I review figures and images?
faq.answer: Use the image-based review workflow for presentations. For figures in manuscripts, use the figure quality checklist for integrity checks.

faq.question: What statistical issues should I look for?
faq.answer: Common issues include p-value misuse, inappropriate tests, underpowered studies, missing multiple testing correction, and circular analysis.

faq.question: Can this skill replace expert review?
faq.answer: No, this provides structured guidance but requires human domain expertise for final assessment and recommendations.
